Authors:
Jiaying Wang, Na Li, Lijuan Mao, Jiaping Lao, Xihui Xu,
Fucheng Lin, Chulong Zhang
Title:
A new endophytic Phomopsis species from southeast of China
based on morphological and phylogenetic analysis
Abstract:
Phomopsis, a worldwide distributed fungus, is a common
group of endophytic fungi. A survey of endophytic fungi from different
host plants in southeast China revealed more than hundreds of Phomopsis
strains. Among them, three strains were characterized by low similarity
of ITS rDNA and tef1-Î± nucleotide sequences with the known Phomopsis
species. Based on a four gene (ITS rDNA, tef1-Î±, MAT1-1-1, MAT1-2-1)
phylogeny and morphological characteristics, they are identified as a
new species, Phomopsis zhejiangensis. Bayesian and maximum parsimony
analysis reveal that P. zhejiangensis forms a distinctive clade within
the genus Phomopsis. This fungus forms smaller pycnidia, spindle to
stick shaped alpha conidia and rarely gamma conidia in the culture.
